name: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development
mission: CONDUCTING WORSHIP SERVICES, CHILDREN AND ADULT RELIGIOUS EDUCATION, FUNERAL FACILITY AND OTHER COMMUNITY SERVICES.
theoryOfChange: By providing accessible Islamic education and essential life-to-legacy services (like burial), the organization strengthens community identity and moral grounding.
zakatClaimEvidence: Please write in a memo what this donation is for (e.g., Zakat, the school, the cemetery, etc.). Make checks payable to: CITCD P.O. Box 2912, Harvey, IL 60426. Zelle Donation. Send to one of our email addresses: info@citcd.org zakat@citcd.org cemetery@citcd.org abraar@citcd.org. (Source: https://citcd.org/donate)

ui_signals_v1.recommendation_rationale: Context dependent profile. Consider cause fit, risk profile, and evidence maturity before deciding.

amalEvaluation.charity_name: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development

components.evidence: Muslim-focused organization (+2); Islamic identity (+1); Asnaf: masakin (+5)
components.improvement_suggestion: Add a dedicated zakat page or clearly state whether donations are zakat-eligible.
components.name: Muslim Donor Fit

alignment.rationale: Alignment 26/50: MEDIUM Muslim donor fit, religious cultural cause area

components.evidence: No beneficiary data available for cost-per-beneficiary scoring; high program ratio (≥85%) suggests efficient delivery
components.improvement_suggestion: Publish beneficiary counts consistently so cost-effectiveness can be assessed.
components.name: Cost Per Beneficiary

components.improvement_suggestion: Publish a time-bound plan to deploy excess unrestricted reserves into mission delivery, while keeping a clear operating reserve floor.
components.name: Financial Health

components.improvement_suggestion: Document a clear theory of change with an explicit causal pathway.
components.name: Theory of Change

risks.description: No outcome measurement or metrics tracking

score_details.score_summary: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development shows moderate impact and moderate alignment (minor risk deductions applied).

zakat.claim_evidence: Please write in a memo what this donation is for (e.g., Zakat, the school, the cemetery, etc.). Make checks payable to: CITCD P.O. Box 2912, Harvey, IL 60426. Zelle Donation. Send to one of our email addresses: info@citcd.org zakat@citcd.org cemetery@citcd.org abraar@citcd.org. (Source: https://citcd.org/donate)

all_citations.claim: The charity maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio and holds 126.5 months of working capital.
The organization reported total revenue of $2,011,605 and a fundraising efficiency of $0.00 per $1 raised.
The organization operates the Abraar Academy and provides religious and community services.
The organization accepts general donations and sadaqah to support its community operations.

baseline_narrative.amal_score_rationale: The organization earns a moderate overall score due to its exceptional financial efficiency and liquidity, balanced against limited third-party verification of its programmatic impact.
areas_for_improvement: Limited external data regarding specific program outcomes and long-term impact metrics
Moderate data confidence levels suggest a need for increased transparency in reporting

dimension_explanations.alignment: The organization serves a medium donor fit by focusing on religious and cultural preservation through education and funeral services [3]. As a sadaqah-eligible entity, it provides a stable platform for general charitable giving within the community [4].
dimension_explanations.impact: The charity demonstrates a strong commitment to its mission by maintaining a 100.0% program expense ratio, ensuring all funds support services like Abraar Academy [1][2]. While it shows high capacity-building potential with 126.5 months of working capital, there is limited publicly available data to measure specific cost-per-beneficiary outcomes [1][3].

baseline_narrative.headline: The Center for Islamic Teachings and Community Development provides comprehensive religious services and educational programs to support the spiritual and communal needs of the local Muslim community.
strengths: Maintains a 100.0% program expense ratio, directing all functional expenses toward its core mission
Exceptional financial liquidity with 126.5 months of working capital available
High fundraising efficiency with a cost of $0.00 per $1 raised
baseline_narrative.summary: Based in Indiana, the organization operates the Abraar Academy and the American Muslim Cemetery while conducting regular worship services and funeral facilities [1][3]. In the 2023 fiscal year, the charity reported a total revenue of $2,011,605 to support its multifaceted community mission [2].
